intro: Seseli alexeenkoi, commonly known as the Crimean seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Crimea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
